trans-unit.source: Azure AD Graph API Operations on Contacts
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Graph API Operations on Contacts

trans-unit.source: Operations on contacts | Graph API reference
trans-unit.target: Operations on contacts | Graph API reference

trans-unit.source: **Applies to:** Graph API | Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: **Applies to:** Graph API | Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses how to perform operations on organizational contacts using the Azure Active Directory (AD) Graph API.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses how to perform operations on organizational contacts using the Azure Active Directory (AD) Graph API.

trans-unit.source: Organizational contacts typically represent users who are external to your company or organization.
trans-unit.target: Organizational contacts typically represent users who are external to your company or organization.

trans-unit.source: They are different from O365 Outlook personal contacts.
trans-unit.target: They are different from O365 Outlook personal contacts.

trans-unit.source: With the Azure AD Graph API, you can read organizational contacts and their relationships to other directory objects, such as their manager, direct reports, and group memberships.
trans-unit.target: With the Azure AD Graph API, you can read organizational contacts and their relationships to other directory objects, such as their manager, direct reports, and group memberships.

trans-unit.source: The ability to write organizational contacts is limited to those contacts that are not currently synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **null** or **false**).
trans-unit.target: The ability to write organizational contacts is limited to those contacts that are not currently synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **null** or **false**).

trans-unit.source: For such contacts, you can update or delete the contact itself or its manager property.
trans-unit.target: For such contacts, you can update or delete the contact itself or its manager property.

trans-unit.source: You cannot create organizational contacts with the Graph API.
trans-unit.target: You cannot create organizational contacts with the Graph API.

trans-unit.source: For more information about organizational contacts, including how they are created in your tenant, see [Contact].
trans-unit.target: For more information about organizational contacts, including how they are created in your tenant, see [Contact].

trans-unit.source: The Graph API is a REST-based API that provides programmatic access to directory objects in Azure Active Directory, such as users, groups, organizational contacts, and applications.
trans-unit.target: The Graph API is a REST-based API that provides programmatic access to directory objects in Azure Active Directory, such as users, groups, organizational contacts, and applications.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Graph API functionality is also available through [Microsoft Graph](https://graph.microsoft.io/), a unified API that also includes APIs from other Microsoft services like Outlook, OneDrive, OneNote, Planner, and Office Graph, all accessed through a single endpoint with a single access token.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Graph API functionality is also available through [Microsoft Graph](https://graph.microsoft.io/), a unified API that also includes APIs from other Microsoft services like Outlook, OneDrive, OneNote, Planner, and Office Graph, all accessed through a single endpoint with a single access token.

trans-unit.source: Performing REST operations on contacts
trans-unit.target: Performing REST operations on contacts

trans-unit.source: To perform operations on organizational contacts with the Graph API, you send HTTP requests with a supported method (GET, POST, PATCH, PUT, or DELETE) to an endpoint that targets the contacts resource collection, a specific contact, a navigation property of a contact, or a function or action that can be called on a contact.
trans-unit.target: To perform operations on organizational contacts with the Graph API, you send HTTP requests with a supported method (GET, POST, PATCH, PUT, or DELETE) to an endpoint that targets the contacts resource collection, a specific contact, a navigation property of a contact, or a function or action that can be called on a contact.

trans-unit.source: Graph API requests use the following basic URL:
trans-unit.target: Graph API requests use the following basic URL:

trans-unit.source: Requests sent to the Graph API must be well-formed, target a valid endpoint and version of the Graph API, and carry a valid access token obtained from Azure AD in their `Authorization` header.
trans-unit.target: Requests sent to the Graph API must be well-formed, target a valid endpoint and version of the Graph API, and carry a valid access token obtained from Azure AD in their `Authorization` header.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information about creating requests and receiving responses with the Graph API, see [Operations Overview].
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information about creating requests and receiving responses with the Graph API, see [Operations Overview].

trans-unit.source: You specify the `{resource_path}` differently depending on whether you are targeting the collection of all contacts in your tenant, an individual contact, or a navigation property of a specific contact.
trans-unit.target: You specify the `{resource_path}` differently depending on whether you are targeting the collection of all contacts in your tenant, an individual contact, or a navigation property of a specific contact.

trans-unit.source: targets the contact resource collection.
trans-unit.target: targets the contact resource collection.

trans-unit.source: You can use this resource path to read all contacts or a filtered list of contacts in your tenant.
trans-unit.target: You can use this resource path to read all contacts or a filtered list of contacts in your tenant.

trans-unit.source: targets an individual contact in your tenant.
trans-unit.target: targets an individual contact in your tenant.

trans-unit.source: You specify the target contact with its object ID (GUID).
trans-unit.target: You specify the target contact with its object ID (GUID).

trans-unit.source: You can use this resource path to get the declared properties of a contact.
trans-unit.target: You can use this resource path to get the declared properties of a contact.

trans-unit.source: For contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory, you can use this resource path to modify the declared properties of a contact, or to delete a contact.
trans-unit.target: For contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory, you can use this resource path to modify the declared properties of a contact, or to delete a contact.

trans-unit.source: targets the specified navigation property of a contact.
trans-unit.target: targets the specified navigation property of a contact.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to return the object or objects referenced by the target navigation property of the specified contact.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to return the object or objects referenced by the target navigation property of the specified contact.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: This form of addressing is only available for reads.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: This form of addressing is only available for reads.

trans-unit.source: targets the specified navigation property of a contact.
trans-unit.target: targets the specified navigation property of a contact.

trans-unit.source: You can use this form of addressing to both read and modify a navigation property.
trans-unit.target: You can use this form of addressing to both read and modify a navigation property.

trans-unit.source: On reads, the objects referenced by the property are returned as one or more links in the response body.
trans-unit.target: On reads, the objects referenced by the property are returned as one or more links in the response body.

trans-unit.source: Only the manager navigation property of contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory can be modified.
trans-unit.target: Only the manager navigation property of contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory can be modified.

trans-unit.source: The manager is specified as a link in the request body.
trans-unit.target: The manager is specified as a link in the request body.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following request returns a link to the specified contact's manager:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following request returns a link to the specified contact's manager:

trans-unit.source: Basic operations on contacts
trans-unit.target: Basic operations on contacts

trans-unit.source: You can perform read operations on contacts by targeting either the contact resource collection or a specific contact.
trans-unit.target: You can perform read operations on contacts by targeting either the contact resource collection or a specific contact.

trans-unit.source: You can update and delete contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory by targeting a specific contact.
trans-unit.target: You can update and delete contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory by targeting a specific contact.

trans-unit.source: The Graph API does not support creating contacts.
trans-unit.target: The Graph API does not support creating contacts.

trans-unit.source: Nor does it support updating or deleting contacts that are synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **true**).
trans-unit.target: Nor does it support updating or deleting contacts that are synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **true**).

trans-unit.source: The following topics show you how to perform basic operations on contacts.
trans-unit.target: The following topics show you how to perform basic operations on contacts.

trans-unit.source: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contacts codeGenerator: true
trans-unit.target: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contacts codeGenerator: true

trans-unit.source: Get contacts
trans-unit.target: Get contacts

trans-unit.source: Gets a collection of contacts.
trans-unit.target: Gets a collection of contacts.

trans-unit.source: You can add OData query parameters to the request to filter, sort, and page the response.
trans-unit.target: You can add OData query parameters to the request to filter, sort, and page the response.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Supported Queries, Filters, and Paging Options].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Supported Queries, Filters, and Paging Options].

trans-unit.source: On success, returns a collection of [Contact] objects; otherwise, the response body contains error details.
trans-unit.target: On success, returns a collection of [Contact] objects; otherwise, the response body contains error details.

trans-unit.source: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].
trans-unit.target: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].

trans-unit.source: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contact by id codeGenerator: true
trans-unit.target: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contact by id codeGenerator: true

trans-unit.source: Get a contact
trans-unit.target: Get a contact

trans-unit.source: Gets a specified contact.
trans-unit.target: Gets a specified contact.

trans-unit.source: You use the object ID (GUID) to identify the target contact.
trans-unit.target: You use the object ID (GUID) to identify the target contact.

trans-unit.source: On success, returns the [Contact] object for the specified contact; otherwise, the response body contains error details.
trans-unit.target: On success, returns the [Contact] object for the specified contact; otherwise, the response body contains error details.

trans-unit.source: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].
trans-unit.target: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].

trans-unit.source: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/update contact
trans-unit.target: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/update contact

trans-unit.source: Update a contact
trans-unit.target: Update a contact

trans-unit.source: Update a contact's properties.
trans-unit.target: Update a contact's properties.

trans-unit.source: Specify any writable [Contact] property in the request body.
trans-unit.target: Specify any writable [Contact] property in the request body.

trans-unit.source: Only the properties that you specify are changed.
trans-unit.target: Only the properties that you specify are changed.

trans-unit.source: You can update only contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **null** or **false**).
trans-unit.target: You can update only contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **null** or **false**).

trans-unit.source: On success, no response body is returned; otherwise, the response body contains error details.
trans-unit.target: On success, no response body is returned; otherwise, the response body contains error details.

trans-unit.source: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].
trans-unit.target: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].

trans-unit.source: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/delete contact
trans-unit.target: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/delete contact

trans-unit.source: Delete a contact
trans-unit.target: Delete a contact

trans-unit.source: Deletes a contact.
trans-unit.target: Deletes a contact.

trans-unit.source: You can delete only contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **null** or **false**).
trans-unit.target: You can delete only contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **null** or **false**).

trans-unit.source: On success, no response body is returned; otherwise, the response body contains error details.
trans-unit.target: On success, no response body is returned; otherwise, the response body contains error details.

trans-unit.source: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].
trans-unit.target: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].

trans-unit.source: Operations on contact navigation properties
trans-unit.target: Operations on contact navigation properties

trans-unit.source: Relationships between a contact and other objects in the directory such as the contact's manager, direct group memberships, and direct reports are exposed through navigation properties.
trans-unit.target: Relationships between a contact and other objects in the directory such as the contact's manager, direct group memberships, and direct reports are exposed through navigation properties.

trans-unit.source: You can read and, in some cases, modify these relationships by targeting these navigation properties in your requests.
trans-unit.target: You can read and, in some cases, modify these relationships by targeting these navigation properties in your requests.

trans-unit.source: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contact manager link codeGenerator: true
trans-unit.target: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contact manager link codeGenerator: true

trans-unit.source: Get a contact's manager
trans-unit.target: Get a contact's manager

trans-unit.source: Gets the contact's manager from the **manager** navigation property.
trans-unit.target: Gets the contact's manager from the **manager** navigation property.

trans-unit.source: On success, returns a link to the [User] or [Contact] assigned as the contact's manager; otherwise, the response body contains error details.
trans-unit.target: On success, returns a link to the [User] or [Contact] assigned as the contact's manager; otherwise, the response body contains error details.

trans-unit.source: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].
trans-unit.target: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].

trans-unit.source: **Note**: You can remove the "$links" segment from the URL to return the [User] or [Contact] object instead of a link.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: You can remove the "$links" segment from the URL to return the [User] or [Contact] object instead of a link.

trans-unit.source: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/update contact manager
trans-unit.target: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/update contact manager

trans-unit.source: Assign a contact's manager
trans-unit.target: Assign a contact's manager

trans-unit.source: Assigns a contact's manager through the **manager** property.
trans-unit.target: Assigns a contact's manager through the **manager** property.

trans-unit.source: Either a user or a contact may be assigned.
trans-unit.target: Either a user or a contact may be assigned.

trans-unit.source: The request body contains a link to the [User] or [Contact] to assign.
trans-unit.target: The request body contains a link to the [User] or [Contact] to assign.

trans-unit.source: You can update the manager only for contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **null** or **false**).
trans-unit.target: You can update the manager only for contacts that are not synced from an on-premises directory (the **dirSyncEnabled** property is **null** or **false**).

trans-unit.source: On success, no response body is returned; otherwise, the response body contains error details.
trans-unit.target: On success, no response body is returned; otherwise, the response body contains error details.

trans-unit.source: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].
trans-unit.target: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].

trans-unit.source: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contact direct reports links codeGenerator: true
trans-unit.target: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contact direct reports links codeGenerator: true

trans-unit.source: Get a contact's direct reports
trans-unit.target: Get a contact's direct reports

trans-unit.source: Gets the contact's direct reports from the **directReports** navigation property.
trans-unit.target: Gets the contact's direct reports from the **directReports** navigation property.

trans-unit.source: On success, returns a collection of links to the [User]'s and [Contact]'s for whom this contact is assigned as manager; otherwise, the response body contains error details.
trans-unit.target: On success, returns a collection of links to the [User]'s and [Contact]'s for whom this contact is assigned as manager; otherwise, the response body contains error details.

trans-unit.source: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].
trans-unit.target: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].

trans-unit.source: **Note**: You can remove the "$links" segment from the URL to return [DirectoryObject]s for the users and contacts instead of links.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: You can remove the "$links" segment from the URL to return [DirectoryObject]s for the users and contacts instead of links.

trans-unit.source: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contact memberOf links codeGenerator: true
trans-unit.target: uid: graph.windows.net/myorganization/Contacts/1.6/get contact memberOf links codeGenerator: true

trans-unit.source: Get a contact's group memberships
trans-unit.target: Get a contact's group memberships

trans-unit.source: Gets the contact's group memberships from the **memberOf** navigation property.
trans-unit.target: Gets the contact's group memberships from the **memberOf** navigation property.

trans-unit.source: This property returns only groups that the contact is a direct member of.
trans-unit.target: This property returns only groups that the contact is a direct member of.

trans-unit.source: To get all of the groups that the contact has direct or transitive membership in, call the [getMemberGroups] function.
trans-unit.target: To get all of the groups that the contact has direct or transitive membership in, call the [getMemberGroups] function.

trans-unit.source: On success, returns a collection of links to the [Group]s that this contact is a member of; otherwise, the response body contains error details.
trans-unit.target: On success, returns a collection of links to the [Group]s that this contact is a member of; otherwise, the response body contains error details.

trans-unit.source: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].
trans-unit.target: For more information about errors, see [Error Codes and Error Handling].

trans-unit.source: **Note**: You can remove the "$links" segment from the URL to return the [DirectoryObject]s for the groups instead of links.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: You can remove the "$links" segment from the URL to return the [DirectoryObject]s for the groups instead of links.

trans-unit.source: Functions and actions on contacts
trans-unit.target: Functions and actions on contacts

trans-unit.source: You can call any of the following functions on a contact.
trans-unit.target: You can call any of the following functions on a contact.

trans-unit.source: Check membership in a specific group (transitive)
trans-unit.target: Check membership in a specific group (transitive)

trans-unit.source: You can call the [isMemberOf] function to check for membership in a specific group.
trans-unit.target: You can call the [isMemberOf] function to check for membership in a specific group.

trans-unit.source: The check is transitive.
trans-unit.target: The check is transitive.

trans-unit.source: Check membership in a list of groups (transitive)
trans-unit.target: Check membership in a list of groups (transitive)

trans-unit.source: You can call the [checkMemberGroups] function to check for membership in a list of groups.
trans-unit.target: You can call the [checkMemberGroups] function to check for membership in a list of groups.

trans-unit.source: The check is transitive.
trans-unit.target: The check is transitive.

trans-unit.source: Get all group memberships (transitive)
trans-unit.target: Get all group memberships (transitive)

trans-unit.source: You can call the [getMemberGroups] function to return all the groups that the contact is a member of.
trans-unit.target: You can call the [getMemberGroups] function to return all the groups that the contact is a member of.

trans-unit.source: The check is transitive, unlike reading the [memberOf](#GetContactsMemberships) navigation property, which returns only the groups that the contact is a direct member of.
trans-unit.target: The check is transitive, unlike reading the [memberOf](#GetContactsMemberships) navigation property, which returns only the groups that the contact is a direct member of.
